p: Emerging nanotechnology-based methods and nano-materials with their unique physical and chemical properties have previously been applied to reduce environmental pollution [ 49]. Silver and other metallic nanoparticles (e.g., zinc oxide) have been developed against waterborne pathogens [ 48]. Carbon nanotubes have been utilized as adsorbents, because of their unique properties beneficial for the removal of organic and inorganic pollutants along with radionuclides [ 52]. Results compared with natural zeolites indicated that the adsorbents are highly efficient and economical. Magnetic graphene oxides have been tested as adsorbates for the removal of trace metals of polybrominated diphenyl ethers in water treatment. They are regarded as highly efficient for environmental remediation [ 53]. Moreover, magnetic nano-composites are used as adsorbents for the removal of heavy metals such as chromium, lead, mercury, and arsenic [ 54].
